title: Rosario Dawson sued by transgender former employee
text:
The actress and her family have been sued for assault, battery, trespass, discrimination, civil rights and labour violations (Picture: FilmMagic)

Rosario Dawson has been sued by a former employee who claims that the actress and her family assaulted him and discriminated against him.

Dedrek Finley, a transgender man who previously went by the name of Deidre before coming out, is suing Rosario, her mother Isabel, her stepfather and uncle for assault, battery, trespass, discrimination, civil rights and labour violations.

Dedrek claims that he came out to the family as transgender after moving from New York City to Los Angeles in 2017 at the request of Rosario’s mother, Isabel.

He also says in his lawsuit that Isabel, her husband Gregory and her brother Gustavo, would regularly refer to him by his old name and use female pronouns rather than his preferred male pronouns, and that Rosario also became involved after allegedly calling him a ‘grown woman’.

He later stated he had been living in a separate home on Rosario’s North Hollywood property, but was told he had to move out in April 2018, after previously agreeing to do renovations on Rosario’s home.

On April 28 2018, Derek alleges that Isabel knocked on his door and became violent with him after he refused to discuss the issue with her, claiming that she ripped the screen off a window and pulled him outside through it, and threatened to kill his cat, while saying, ‘You’re not so much of a man now.’

He claims that he thought Rosario would come to his defense, but instead she helped to pin him down so her mother could continue to attack him, and that one of the two women would take his phone away from him as they knew it contained footage of Isabel threatening him earlier in the year.

Rosario allegedy called Dedrek a ‘grown woman’ (Picture: Getty Images)

The lawsuit later states that Dedrek was able to eventually make his way into Rosario’s home where he phoned 911, with police responding to the incident and Dedrek being taken to hospital.

Dedrek claims that he was eventually forced out of his home around September 2018 as his living conditions were made more difficult after his gas was turned off.
